overview: The Musicology & Ethnomusicology major is a rigorous program that prepares you to think and write about the aesthetics, significance, and meaning of music across diverse historical and cross-cultural contexts.

Musicology & Ethnomusicology students acquire skills and knowledge to explore how people use music in constructing cultural and personal meaning, as well as to understand how gender, race and politics shape people’s musical lives.

Structure: 225 credit points
To obtain a major in Musicology & Ethnomusicology students will need to complete:

137.5 credit points of core subjects including
62.5 credit points of Level 1 core subjects including
37.5 credit points of Level 1 Musicology and Ethnomusicology core subjects
25 credit points of Level 1 Composition stream subjects or 25 credit points of Level 1 Practical Music stream subjects


25 credit points of Level 2 Musicology & Ethnomusicology core subjects
50 credit points of Level 3 Musicology & Ethnomusicology core subjects including
37.5 credit points of Level 3 Musicology and Ethnomusicology core subjects
12.5 credit points of Level 3 Musicology and Ethnomusicology selective subjects

Transfer Major Rules::
Students may apply to transfer into the Musicology & Ethnomusicology Major from the Performance Major OR Composition Major.
To transfer to Musicology & Ethnomusicology Major Year 2 students must:

complete all Level 1 core subjects in the Performance Major OR Composition Major; and



have permission of the coordinator.




complete all Level 1 core subjects in the Performance Major OR Composition Major; and


have permission of the coordinator.

To transfer to Musicology & Ethnomusicology Major Year 3 students must:
have sufficient points remaining in the degree to complete all major requirements not yet met; and
have permission of the coordinator.

Musicology & Ethnomusicology electives: Students must complete 50 credit points of Musicology & Ethnomusicology elective subjects from the subjects below

Musicology & Ethnomusicology electives.MUSI10219: Rock Music: From Roots to Retro Credits
Musicology & Ethnomusicology electives.MUSI20120: Paris! Berlioz to the Ballets Russes Credits
Musicology & Ethnomusicology electives.MUSI30011: Music in the Culture of the Renaissance Credits
Musicology & Ethnomusicology electives.MUSI30015: Sex, Death and the Ecstatic in Music Credits
Musicology & Ethnomusicology electives.MUSI30271: Topics in Popular Music Studies Credits
